root: ^You have found a young child while wandering about town. You rush home to tell your mom the good news!
^Let's go have fun at the playground!

Playground: ^The playground is always exciting! Ugh, it's the Bicycle queen.
SupportKimmy: ^Dana: Blythe, knock it off! I’m a babysitter so you can’t bug me anymore, got it?
^Blythe: Poor Dana. Poor Kimmy. You can’t get away from me! I’m the bicycle lord.
^Blythe: I’ll only stop following you if you play a game with me.
BlytheFriend: ^Kimmy: I didn’t know bullies liked games.
^Blythe: I’m not thaaaat evil. I found a newt this morning and slipped it into Janey’s purse, but I could have dropped it down her dress… but I’m nice, I wouldn’t do that.
ConfrontBlythe: ^Dana: That’s… neither of those options are nice, Blythe.
^Blythe: I just like to mess with girls. But I take games seriously. So you better play with me some more, you little brat.
ProtectKimmy: ^Dana: Don’t talk that way to Kimmy!
^Dana: You’re mean to girls. I’ve seen you chasing girls around the neighborhood. It’s bad and you’re going to get in trouble with the adults.
^Blythe: Quiet Kimmy alone and tied up on the porch.. How much did you pay Dana to be your friend anyways?
DeclareFriendship: ^Dana: I’m her friend and babysitter, but it’s none of your business anyways.
FaceBlythe: ^Dana: Don’t be mean to Kimmy, or I’ll really get mad. I’ll… tell your mom that you were being rude!
^Blythe: Haha, yeah right. I’ll be nice but only if you and Kimmy play more games with me.
Reject: ^Dana: Uh, no. We might play games with you, but not just so you’ll be nice. Maybe we can teach you some manners.
BlytheGame: ^Blythe: I love that game. Haha, what a rush.
ExpressSurprise: ^Dana: Well… that was nice. I’m surprised you hadn’t played before though, Blythe. You always brag about how good you are at games, and how you know so many.
^Kimmy: I wanna know more games than Blythe!
SupportKimmy1: ^Blythe: Pfft. Good luck. I’m gonna go catch bugs later. That’s better than games.
Janey: ^Janey: You know the Grenada movie theatre? I got a summer job there. I started last week.
KimmyExcited: ^Kimmy: Wow… my mom took me there once...
^Janey: What did you see? I go to the movies a lot, so I bet I saw it too.
^Kimmy: Oh… we saw the movie with the… Uh... the fairy godmother and the shoe…
^ Kimmy is talking all on her own...
KimmyConvo: ^Kimmy: Yeah... and we saw Mary Poppins.
^Janey: I saw that at The Grenada too. It was so great.
InquireJaney: ^Dana: If we go see a movie there, where would we find you?
^Janey: I’m at the snack counter, but I’m too little to be a cashier. I’m helping make popcorn… just until I’m old enough to do something more serious.
JaneyProud: ^Janey: Yeah, it’s pretty awesome to be at the snack counter. I love popcorn. I can have free soda whenever I want, too.
ShowOffJob: ^Dana: I also have a summer job! I’m babysitting Kimmy! I wasn’t planning on working, but I think it’s great.
^Janey: My mom said a summer job is important. I didn’t want her to think I was lazy, and I love movies so I got my cousin to help me get the job. He sells tickets there.
NoLazy: ^Dana: I’m glad I won’t be lazy this summer. I think I’m getting too old to be lazy. I mean, I’m going into the 5th grade.
^Janey: Yeah, it’s more fun to be out with people who aren’t just teachers and classmates too.
^Janey: By the way, I’m not working today. Wanna play together?
NoGame: ^Janey: Oh, alright. I guess I'll see you around.
JaneyFriend: ^Dana: Say… do you think you’ll ever try joining the school theatre, Janey? I was thinking of auditioning for a play next year…
^Janey: I could, but my mom’s YWCA theatre group is… better.
^Kimmy: I like seeing the plays at school. Can we be in one together, Dana?
AnswerKimmy1: ^Dana: I know, I wish we were in school together. But I’m at Cheverus, not Lincoln Elementary. I can’t be in a play at a school I don’t go to.
^Kimmy: Oh… are you at Cheverus too, Janey?
^Janey: Yes, I am. Both my parents went to Catholic school too.
UnhappyKimmy: ^Kimmy: I go to Lincoln Elementary School.
^Janey: You should audition for your school’s play, Kimmy. You’re cute so I bet you’d get a good part. Probably a love interest.
CrazyJaney: ^Janey: Cute girls usually get cast as love interests. You know, like a Juliet. Or a Tzeitel.
^Kimmy: I wouldn’t want a big part… or a… a love part...
ConversationChange: ^Dana: Me neither! I think I’d get stage fright normally, but especially if I had to be romantic with some boy.
^Janey: The romantic parts are the most fun--you might even get to do a stage kiss.
^Kimmy: Maybe theatre isn’t fun after all…
CrushDreams: ^Janey: Kimmy, it is! I know you’re… a bit of a loner, so it’d probably be good for you to do theatre. You’d learn how to be more social.
KimmyDefend: ^Dana: Kimmy’s not a loner! You're making lots of friends today, right Kimmy? We’re going to play with everyone!
^Dana: Also, it’s ok to want to be alone sometimes. But, everyone needs friends.
KimmyConfused: ^Janey: Hah! You want friends, Kimmy. All kids do.
^Janey: I just think it’s sad to be a loner, so…
AwkwardSilence: ^Janey: …well if you ever want to do some theatre, just let me know.
^Janey: Or just get a job when you’re a bit older, I guess. You won’t be lonely if you’re working hard.
JaneyGame: ^Dana: That’s it! Good job Janey, you picked that up fast!
^Janey: My dad says I’m a fast learner. I can even beat Anthony at Tic Tac Toe sometimes.
UpsetKimmy: ^Kimmy: I don’t think I’m a fast learner...
^Dana: I think you are! You’re great, Kimmy.
^Janey: Don’t worry, you’re sharper than Jimmy at the very least…
Reprimand: ^Janey: You’re so little, Kimmy, it’s ok. You have time. Get a job like Dana and I and you’ll feel smarter in no time.
^Kimmy: I want to be smart and big like you two…
SlowDown: ^Dana: Let’s make you some friends first. You can worry about jobs later.
Linda: ^Kimmy: Hi Linda... I haven’t seen you in a while.
^Linda: I went to visit my auntie right when school ended.
ConversationEnter: ^Dana: Hi, Linda. Do you know Kimmy?
ReassureKimmy: ^Dana: It’s not so far. You can even ride your bike there. Sometimes my sisters and I go. We like to go explore all the clothes shops. Like Filene's.
^Linda: I don’t really go shopping, unless it’s for stuffed animals.
^Kimmy: Dana is babysitting me, so she can go shopping with the quarters my mom gives her!
Proud: ^Linda: Oh, having a job is good. When I’m a little older I want to get one at an animal shelter or something. I like playing with dogs.
^Dana: We’re looking for people to play games with. Want to play a game with us, Linda?
^Linda: I guess so. I was playing with Donna earlier, but I could play some more.
LindaGame: ^Linda: I usually only play games with my dad or brothers, but that was fun.
KimmySmile: ^Kimmy: Th--thanks for playing with us, Linda.
^Linda: I’m going to visit my auntie again in a few weeks, so I’ll see if maybe she’ll want to learn
^... thanks for teaching it to me.
ThankLinda: ^Dana: Oh, thank you Linda. You’re a good student!
^Linda: I like to learn stuff. I’m glad it’s summer break though… we never get assigned anything fun in school. But my auntie gave me some biology books to read and it’s really fun.
ConfusedKimmy: ^Linda: It’s about studying living stuff like plants and animals, and people sometimes too.
^Dana: I hope I get to take biology soon. I like math and science classes a lot.
^Kimmy: If I could study dogs, I think I’d be happy...
LindaFriend: ^Dana: Where does your auntie do her biology stuff?
^Linda: She works with animals at Stoneham Zoo.
ExpressEnthusiasm: ^Linda: You’ve really never been to a zoo, Kimmy?
AnswerKimmy: ^Dana: It’s ok, Kimmy. A zoo is a place where you can see wild animals. Like elephants and stuff.
^Kimmy: I thought that’s what a circus was?
^Linda: Animals in a circus are more like performers. They do tricks and stuff.
^Linda: Animals in a zoo are studied by scientists, like my aunt.
ExpressConcern: ^Dana: I think I’d get a little nervous around the bigger animals. I’d want to work with the small ones--like penguins.
^Linda: She loves it. But she’s stressed a lot too. She’s working on her degree in Biology right now at college and she’s really busy.
KimmyResponse: ^Kimmy: Your auntie sounds amazing… I don’t even know what I want to do when I grow up.
^Linda: My auntie told me not to pick my career until I’m older, because I might find something else I like to do in high school. But I think I’ll still want to work with animals like she does.
GetIntoConversation: ^Dana: My dad is an engineer, so sometimes I think that would be an interesting job, but I like a lot of other things too. I love fashion.
^Kimmy: I like… candy. I wonder if I can make candy when I grow up…
^Linda: Auntie says I can do anything, so I bet you can make candy. That’s someone’s job somewhere.
ShareDream: ^Dana: Actually, I think I want to be a mom.
^Linda: I want to be a dog mom.
ExpressIncorrectOpinion: ^Linda: Dogs are just as afraid of you. If you’re nice to them, you have nothing to worry about.
^Dana: What if one is chasing me?
^Linda: If a dog chases me, I stop and pet it.
KimmyOpinion: ^Dana: I got chased once and had to climb a tree to escape… I guess I’ll try petting next time.
